explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of machine learning in predicting high-cost members.
explanations.supervised learning: The use of extreme gradient boosting algorithm to develop risk scores implies a supervised learning approach, where the model is trained on labeled data.
explanations.classification: The task of predicting high-cost members can be framed as a classification problem, where members are classified into high-cost or not high-cost categories.
explanations.decision tree: Extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost) is an ensemble method that often uses decision trees as base learners, indicating the relevance of decision trees in this context.
